header_summary: Programmer publishes draft bLIP integrating Taproot Asset Protocol into BOLT channel format. Proposal enables holding and transferring assets within taproot channels. RFQ last-mile negotiation scheme allows multi-hop payments. Invoices denominated in BTC, no need for knowledge of exchange rates. Feedback welcomed for protocol enhancement. Version 0.3 of tapd approaching mainnet release, enabling asset transfers on Lightning Network.

recent_posts.title: Actuarial System To Reduce Interactivity In N-of-N (N > 2) Multiparticipant Offchain Mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses loose interactivity and the need for `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` in a specific context.
- The actuary can gather signatures for the next state while signing new transactions on top of it.
- `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` allows spending the actual or current state plus additional transactions.

recent_posts.title: New BIP to align descriptors, xpub derivation and miniscript
recent_posts.summary:
- Some wallets supporting descriptors maintain vague BIP44 compatibility, but derivation paths are not committed.
- BIP44 compatibility is useful in certain wallets, like Bitcoin Core, despite being descriptor-based.
- Reusing public keys within Miniscripts is possible by deriving different hardened xpubs or appending unhardened steps.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses feedback on a proposal for classifying users and designing protocols.
- It raises concerns about the complexity of trust assumptions and scaling dimensions.
- The email also questions group coordination, routing, and fault-tolerance in off-chain constructions.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine suggests that classifying users as "casual" or "dedicated" may not be straightforward.
- He questions the accuracy of a statement regarding Lightning channels and provides a proposed solution.
- Antoine highlights the difficulty of group coordination and raises concerns about fault-tolerance.

recent_posts.title: CLBOSS v0.13 aka "Born to Run" Release
recent_posts.summary:
- CLBOSS is now compliant with modern CLN versions, marking an important milestone.
- The release focuses on reviving the project, with gratitude towards Ken's initiative.
- More information about CLBOSS and its features can be found in the provided link.

recent_posts.title: blip-0029: Taproot Asset Protocol Channels
recent_posts.summary:
- A programmer has published a draft bLIP that explains the Taproot Asset Protocol mapping.
- The bLIP introduces support for holding and transferring assets using the Taproot Assets Protocol.
- An RFQ last-mile negotiation scheme is used for multi-hop payments and ensures asset compatibility.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing a version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- The server will be fully 'blinded' and will not learn certain key information.
- The protocol involves key and nonce aggregation for signing messages while maintaining security.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Based on several factors, storage for blockchain is sufficiently limited.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can last 21 years without running out of space.
- Ongoing optimization efforts and affordable hardware ensure sufficient storage for blockchain.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes revised and improved implementation and new opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV).
- The author looks forward to comments and starting a BIP proposal.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to resume lightning channels from a wallet seed.
- It addresses channel backup issues and introduces fraud proofs to detect revoked states.
- The proposal suggests saving bandwidth by only sending necessary information in channel commitments.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- The summit will benefit from a multi-stakeholder approach to ensure fairness and transparency.
- Antoine invites objections or feedback and suggests surveying countries for potential hosting.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to document an idea for securely sending commands.
- The architecture uses a hardware security module as a whitelisted lightning peer.
- Bastien proposes to implement the idea using a Ledger Nano S and suggests open-source grant funding.
